<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This implements an analysis pass that tries to delinearize all GEP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instructions in all loops using the SCEV analysis functionality. This pass is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// only used for testing purposes: if your pass needs delinearization, please</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// use the on-demand SCEVAddRecExpr::delinearize() function.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define LLVM&#95;ANALYSIS&#95;DELINEARIZATION&#95;H</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">template</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">typename</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> T&gt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/getelementptrinst">GetElementPtrInst</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Compute the array dimensions Sizes from the set of Terms extracted from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the memory access function of this SCEVAddRecExpr (second step of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// delinearization).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a174350306649bc16f97803763bcae8f7">findArrayDimensions</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Terms,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Sizes,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;ElementSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Collect parametric terms occurring in step expressions (first step of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// delinearization).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a15de929cad74fd49804c28fe22c149a9">collectParametricTerms</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;Expr,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlight">                            <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Terms);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Return in Subscripts the access functions for each dimension in Sizes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (third step of delinearization).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a62f4b8744e4b75d5371fb9a8a471ca26">computeAccessFunctions</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;Expr,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlight">                            <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Subscripts,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlight">                            <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Sizes);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Split this SCEVAddRecExpr into two vectors of SCEVs representing the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// subscripts and sizes of an array access.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The delinearization is a 3 step process: the first two steps compute the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// sizes of each subscript and the third step computes the access functions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// for the delinearized array:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 1 Find the terms in the step functions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 2 Compute the array size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 3 Compute the access function: divide the SCEV by the array size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    starting with the innermost dimensions found in step 2 The Quotient</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    is the SCEV to be divided in the next step of the recursion. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    Remainder is the subscript of the innermost dimension. Loop over all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    array dimensions computed in step 2</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// To compute a uniform array size for several memory accesses to the same</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// object, one can collect in step 1 all the step terms for all the memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// accesses, and compute in step 2 a unique array shape. This guarantees</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// that the array shape will be the same across all memory accesses.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// FIXME: We could derive the result of steps 1 and 2 from a description of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the array shape given in metadata.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Example:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A&#91;&#93;&#91;n&#93;&#91;m&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// for i</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   for j</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     for k</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///       A&#91;j+k&#93;&#91;2i&#93;&#91;5i&#93; =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The initial SCEV:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A&#91;&#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,2&#42;m+5&#125;&#95;i, +, n&#42;m&#125;&#95;j, +, n&#42;m&#125;&#95;k&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 1 Find the different terms in the step functions:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// -&gt; &#91;2&#42;m, 5, n&#42;m, n&#42;m&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 2 Compute the array size: sort and unique them</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// -&gt; &#91;n&#42;m, 2&#42;m, 5&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// find the GCD of all the terms = 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// divide by the GCD and erase constant terms</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// -&gt; &#91;n&#42;m, 2&#42;m&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// GCD = m</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// divide by GCD -&gt; &#91;n, 2&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// remove constant terms</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// -&gt; &#91;n&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// size of the array is A&#91;unknown&#93;&#91;n&#93;&#91;m&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 3 Compute the access function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a. Divide &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,2&#42;m+5&#125;&#95;i, +, n&#42;m&#125;&#95;j, +, n&#42;m&#125;&#95;k by the innermost size m</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Quotient: &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,2&#125;&#95;i, +, n&#125;&#95;j, +, n&#125;&#95;k</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Remainder: &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,5&#125;&#95;i, +, 0&#125;&#95;j, +, 0&#125;&#95;k</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The remainder is the subscript of the innermost array dimension: &#91;5i&#93;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// b. Divide Quotient: &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,2&#125;&#95;i, +, n&#125;&#95;j, +, n&#125;&#95;k by next outer size n</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Quotient: &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,0&#125;&#95;i, +, 1&#125;&#95;j, +, 1&#125;&#95;k</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Remainder: &#123;&#123;&#123;0,+,2&#125;&#95;i, +, 0&#125;&#95;j, +, 0&#125;&#95;k</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The Remainder is the subscript of the next array dimension: &#91;2i&#93;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The subscript of the outermost dimension is the Quotient: &#91;j+k&#93;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Overall, we have: A&#91;&#93;&#91;n&#93;&#91;m&#93;, and the access function: A&#91;j+k&#93;&#91;2i&#93;&#91;5i&#93;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abc378caf5071493fe3b2b98bf224be7c">delinearize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;Expr,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlight">                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Subscripts,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlight">                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Sizes, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;ElementSize);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Gathers the individual index expressions from a GEP instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This function optimistically assumes the GEP references into a fixed size</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// array. If this is actually true, this function returns a list of array</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// subscript expressions in \\p Subscripts and a list of integers describing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the size of the individual array dimensions in \\p Sizes. Both lists have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// either equal length or the size list is one element shorter in case there</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is no known size available for the outermost array dimension. Returns true</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// if successful and false otherwise.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8287f8eaeb936bb75dc1bb6ef39fbdd1">getIndexExpressionsFromGEP</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &amp;SE,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/getelementptrinst">GetElementPtrInst</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/hexagon/hexagoncommongep-cpp/#ad532e8710e50302e0a376b61c91fa91d">GEP</a>,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Subscripts,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;int&gt;</a> &amp;Sizes);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Implementation of fixed size array delinearization. Try to delinearize</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// access function for a fixed size multi-dimensional array, by deriving</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// subscripts from GEP instructions. Returns true upon success and false</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// otherwise. \\p Inst is the load/store instruction whose pointer operand is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the one we want to delinearize. \\p AccessFn is its corresponding SCEV</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// expression w.r.t. the surrounding loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab73239c9eac42ae767c00ecc64e98dff">tryDelinearizeFixedSizeImpl</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a> &#42;SE, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;Inst,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                 </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> &#42;AccessFn,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;const SCEV &#42;&gt;</a> &amp;Subscripts,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                 <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;int&gt;</a> &amp;Sizes);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"></CodeLine>
